column1: Piastów [ˈpʲastuf] is a town in central Poland
column4: 331 inhabitants (2006 est). It is situated in the Masovian Voivodship (since 1999); previously
column5: it was in Warszawa Voivodship (1975–1998). With 3963 persons/km²
column6: it is the second most densely populated city in Poland (after Świętochłowice).

column2: the villages of Żdżary and Utrata existed in the place of today's' Piastów. Piastów is served by Piastów railway station.
